content: | page 5 begin ribbing begin ribbing row 1 rs p1 * k1 p1 repeat from * to end of row round 1 *k1 p1 repeat from * to bor row 2 ws k1 * p1 k1 repeat from * to end of row work round 1 5 more times 6 row total repeat row 1 and 2 two more times 6 row total do not switch back to main gauge needles switch back to main gauge needles work 6 row in stockinette knit all stitches work 6 row in stockinette bind off all sts bind off all sts place back stitches onto main gauge needles pocket to create a neat overlap of the front ribbing stitches over knit pocket square as follows the back stitches at the split pick up and knit 3 sts from inside of front side ribbing you will be picking up one co 25 sts stitch into each of the 3 rib sts of the left seam k across back stitches then pick up and knit 3 sts from inside of side work in stockinette until pocket measures 4 / 10 cm from ribbing at the opposite side cast on bind off proceed to work as for front hem as follows finishing row 1 ws k1 p1 k1 p to last 3 sts k1 p1 k1 row 2 rs p1 k1 p1 k to next marker sm p1 k1 p1 weave in ends and block sweater and pocket being sure not to flatten rolled edges of sweater repeat row 1 and 2 until back measures 2 5 / 6 5 cm from split ending with a ws row choose pocket placement we opted for lower right font secure with pins or locking stitch markers and sew on to switch to smaller needles sweater using darning needle sewn stitches should be placed one knit stitch in from left and right pocket edges begin ribbing and just above cast-on row of pocket at bottom row 1 rs p1 * k1 p1 repeat from * to end of row row 2 ws k1 * p1 k1 repeat from * to end of row repeat row 1 and 2 two more times 6 row total switch back to main gauge needles work 6 row in stockinette bind off all sts sleeves put 67 73 77 81 85 91 95 101 sleeve sts on 16 main gauge needles place bor pick up and knit 3 stitches from body at underarm join for working in the round round 1 p1 k1 p1 knit to end repeat round 1 until sleeve measures 16 / 40 5 cm from underarm or until desired length note that cuff ribbing will add approximately 1 / 2 5 cm switch to smaller 16 needles © sonder yarn co 2025 | www
